decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game by creating a lock with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to generate a powerful 20/20 creature token. It also utilizes lands like Wasteland and Boseiju, Who Endures to disrupt opponents' strategies while ramping with cards like Exploration and Ancient Tomb. The inclusion of cards like The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Maze of Ith helps to stall opponents' creatures, allowing the player to establish a dominant board presence. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through land manipulation and powerful combos.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently assemble the Cephalid Breakfast combo, utilizing cards like Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill through the library and then use Thassa's Oracle or Narcomoeba to win the game on the spot. The deck includes strong disruption through counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, along with card selection with Ponder and Brainstorm. Urza's Saga provides additional value by tutoring for key combo pieces, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps dig for combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on using Aether Vial to quickly and efficiently get creatures onto the battlefield while disrupting the opponent's plans with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will. It also utilizes the blink mechanic to gain extra value from entering the battlefield effects of creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Baleful Strix. The deck has a mix of aggressive creatures, disruptive spells, and card advantage engines to overwhelm opponents and maintain control of the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with key creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, and then reanimating them with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo pieces. The deck aims to cheat out powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game, overwhelming the opponent with threats that are difficult to deal with. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands.

The main concept of this Dragon Stompy deck is to disrupt your opponent's mana base with cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, and Chalice of the Void while ramping up your own mana with Ancient Tomb and Chrome Mox. The deck also utilizes powerful dragons like Broadside Bombardiers and Fury to quickly close out the game. Additionally, cards like Sundering Eruption provide removal options while Urza's Saga helps to tutor for powerful artifacts. Overall, the deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combination of cards to generate a strong board presence and overwhelming advantage. By utilizing cards like Mystic Forge and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to quickly establish a dominant position on the battlefield. The inclusion of cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Karn, the Great Creator allows for further manipulation of the game state, while cards like Manifold Key and Grim Monolith provide additional support and acceleration. Overall, the deck is built around maximizing resource efficiency and leveraging its powerful synergies to control the game and emerge victorious.

The deck is built around the combination of Nomads en-Kor and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to generate infinite mana and draw the entire deck. Other cards like Green Sun's Zenith and Brainstorm help find the combo pieces, while cards like Swords to Plowshares and Teferi, Time Raveler provide control and protection. The deck also includes cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for additional value. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently combo off by casting a high number of spells that manipulate the graveyard, generate mana, and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win the game by milling through the library and utilizing cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to put key pieces like Thassa's Oracle into play. The deck runs minimal lands and focuses on a fast and explosive game plan to outpace and overwhelm the opponent before they can establish a board presence.

Utilize powerful mana ramp through Cloudpost lands and artifacts to quickly play high-cost Eldrazi threats such as Ulamog and Thought-Knot Seer. Use Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin planeswalkers to control the board and shut down opponent's strategies. The deck aims to lock down the game with cards like Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void, while also having access to mass removal with All Is Dust. Planar Nexus and The One Ring provide additional resources and versatility to outvalue the opponent and overwhelm them with huge threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands to control and disrupt the opponent's strategy while ramping up its own resources. It aims to quickly assemble the Dark Depths/Thespian's Stage combo to create a powerful 20/20 Marit Lage token. The deck also includes cards like Wasteland and Crop Rotation to disrupt the opponent's mana base, as well as Boseiju, Who Endures to protect important spells from countermagic. Life from the Loam helps to recur lands and maintain card advantage, while Exploration accelerates land drops. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around land-based control and disruption.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Murktide Regent using cards like Entomb and Reanimate. It also includes cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to provide card advantage. The deck utilizes combo potential by bringing back creatures from the graveyard to overwhelm the opponent. Control elements like Force of Will and Thoughtseize help protect the combo pieces while disruption cards like Wasteland and Daze can slow down the opponent's game plan. Ultimately, the deck aims to quickly assemble its key combo pieces to win the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing various graveyard interactions to quickly bring powerful creatures into play, while also maintaining control over the opponent's resources through disruptive spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize. By combining the reanimation strategy with cards like Entomb and Reanimate, the deck can easily put pressure on the opponent with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Brazen Borrower and Daze for tempo plays and disruption, making it a versatile and potent combo-reanimator archetype in Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck focuses on quickly generating creature tokens and utilizing various spells to control the board. The deck aims to apply early pressure with aggressive creatures like Ocelot Pride and Orcish Bowmasters, while also controlling the opponent's board with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Force of Will. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provide additional card advantage and removal options. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Cabal Therapy and Daze to further hinder the opponent's game plan. The mana base is built to support the deck's aggressive strategy while also providing flexibility for various spells.

This deck focuses on assembling the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library. It utilizes cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to search for and play key pieces of the combo. Agatha's Soul Cauldron provides additional value by recurring important cards from the graveyard. The inclusion of red elemental blast and pyroblast helps protect the combo from disruption, while cards like Lightning Bolt offer some removal and burn potential. With Jegantha as a companion, the deck aims to consistently execute its game plan and win through the combo.

This deck focuses on utilizing creature tutors like Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling to assemble the combo of Nomads en-Kor, Shaman en-Kor, and Nadu, Winged Wisdom. By continuously targeting and untapping Nomads en-Kor with Shaman en-Kor's ability, players can draw their entire deck and generate infinite mana with Gaea's Cradle to cast Craterhoof Behemoth for the win. The deck also includes disruptive creatures like Collector Ouphe and Allosaurus Shepherd to protect the combo. Additional utility cards like Once Upon a Time and Endurance provide flexibility and resilience to the strategy.

The deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bring them back onto the battlefield for a swift victory. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will help protect the combo, while cards like Daze and Wasteland can disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent for additional threats and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for card advantage. Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Archon of Cruelty provide additional game-ending threats to help secure the win.
